docs.text: in the interest of being generous , i want to start this review with the scene that i liked in meet joe black .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sir anthony hopkins , playing a super-rich media mogul , has gathered his family around him for dinner .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: his oldest daughter ( played by marcia gay harden from millers crossing ) , who has been obsessively planning his sinfully extravagant birthday party , presents him with three superbly decorated little cakes , which are supposed to be scale models for his big birthday cake .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the daughter asks hopkins to pick the one he likes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: hopkins , frustrated by the weight of planning for the whole elaborate affair , does what any man in his position would do : he punts .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: whichever one you like , dear , he says .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and the daughter does exactly what any woman in her position would do : she cries .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i liked that scene for two reasons .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: first , the cakes looked really cool .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: second , it was , perhaps , the only scene in the movie where people acted as you would expect people to act .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: meet joe black is chock-full of odd performances , people doing things for no discernible reason at all , and doing them in slow motion over the course of three hours to boot .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's easy to watch meet joe black for the abundant eye candy of the palatial homes and the beauteous claire forlani , but it's even easier to sleep right through it ( two people on my row managed it quite nicely ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the difficult part of the movie is understanding the characters and their motivations and why someone thought three hours was an appropriate length for this overwrought mess .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i know my audience had problems with the movie , because they thought it was a comedy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: case in point : everyone should know by now that brad pitt plays the angel of death in this movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , the first we see of him is as a young lawyer in a coffee shop hitting on the glamorous claire forlani .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( it's not clear from the movie whether you need a law degree to become the angel of death , but it makes a certain kind of sense . )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it shouldn't take long for the observant moviegoer to realize that bad things are about to happen to mr . pitt .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and indeed they do ( after a hideously prolonged sequence where pitt looks over his shoulder at the retreating forlani and forlani looks over her shoulder at the retreating pitt ) , because pitt walks into the road without looking and suddenly gets squished .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: well , when that happened , the audience howled with laughter , and continued to laugh at every comment that was remotely humorous .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so , if you think that sudden violent death and sarcastic drawing-room humor are funny , i encourage you to go see meet joe black immediately .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: anyway , the deceased lawyer's body , no worse the wear from its massive injuries , is possessed by the angel of death and brad pitt takes over that role .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the idea is that death ( given the pen name of joe black , so as not to disturb others ) wants to take a holiday and experience the world .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if this weren't hollywood , we might get an interesting metaphysical discussion of life and death , but since it is , we get scene after scene of fish-out-of-water humor , just as if death is george of the jungle or crocodile dundee or some other poor schmuck who's wandered in from the jungle or the outback or whatever and doesn't know how to act in our society .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it also doesn't help that the character of death is written so inconsistently .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he claims to be on vacation , but he never does anything except hang around the seriously attractive claire forlani ( just try to get your travel agent to book that one ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he speaks very slow and halting english but perfectly fluent jamaican patois .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he knows everything about some characters , nothing about others .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and as played by brad pitt , he's not especially menacing or charming or glamorous or intriguing , he's just there .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's as if someone told pitt , " never mind about acting in this picture , son , just stand there and look pretty . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's as if pitt is doing his keanu reeves impression throughout the movie .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i've used the phrase " angel of death " in this review very deliberately to contrast pitt's performance with this year's best angel performance , nicolas cage's in city of angels .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: where pitt is cold and unfeeling , cage is as warm and empathetic as the situation allows .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: where cage is genuinely curious about the nature of man , pitt is aloof and arrogant .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: cage struck instant chemical sparks with co-star meg ryan , where the chemistry between pitt and forlani is only understandable if you accept the notion that forlani's character is so shallow that she can't see beyond pitt's good looks .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie's other top name is a much better actor , but that doesn't save meet joe black .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sir anthony hopkins isn't given much better material to work with , unfortunately .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he plays one of these good-hearted multimillionaire media moguls that only exist in hollywood .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( one wonders what might have happened if they had made hopkins's character more realistically evil . )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: hopkins is marked for death due to a bad ticker , but death steps in and grants him some extra time in exchange for being his guide in the world .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: of course , no one can be sure of how they will act when death taps on their shoulder .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but i have to wonder ( and in this movie , you have a very long time to wonder ) how you or i would act in a similar situation , especially if you or i were a multimillionaire .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: hopkins pretty much goes to the office -- and the major subplot revolves around who will control the corporation .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: fans of corporate intrigue will be fascinated , i'm sure .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i stayed awake all the way through meet joe black , and i'm asking myself why .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: movies about death should encourage you to live life to the fullest , which is what i'm going to do now .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: go spend time with your family , go volunteer for a local charity , heck , go take a nap .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: don't go see meet joe black , because all it will do is move you three long hours closer to death .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: -- curtis edmonds
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " no children have ever meddled with the republican party and lived to tell about it . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: -- sideshow bob
docs.label: negative
